DataElement.preferredName: Patient Sufficient Hematology Function Eligibility Determination Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator of criteria to determine eligibility of patients meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement of normal action in regards to the blood or blood-forming organs.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Sufficient Hematology Function Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement of normal action in regards to the blood or blood-forming organs.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement; enough to meet the needs of a situation.:The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.:The normal action performed by a structure or device.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement; enough to meet the needs of a situation.
The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.
The normal action performed by a structure or device.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Workflow and Registration Status Changed per Brenda Duggan; 05.16.18; Reviewed DEC and DE and changed WF and registration status to released. bsm 8/3/2021

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 requested By Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership  transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/23/16 jk value "Not evaluable" added in error by COG on 3/21/16 was removed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have adequate he
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have adequate hematological function?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been found to have adequate hematologic function in the past 28 days

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have adequate hematologic function based on the most recent test results obtained within 28 days prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have hematologic function assessed within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have hematologic function assessed within 14 days prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have adequate hematologic function within 14 days prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been found to have adequate hematologic function within 28 days before randomization? (as defined by protocol section 3.1.9)

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does he patient have adequate hematologic function within 14 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have adequate hematologic function within 14 days prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have adequate hematologic function within 14 days prior to Step 2 registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have hematologic function amendable to allow for treatment with chemotherapy and concurrent radiation, per the treating physician?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have hematologic function amenable to allow for treatment with chemotherapy and concurrent radiation, per the treating physician?
